likutei-moharan.descriptionFrench: The great, holy and awesome work of our teacher Rabbi Nachman of Breslov. Contains hundreds of "teachings" - holy discourses given by Rabbenu on Sabbaths, holidays and various occasions.
likutei-moharan.descriptionSpanish: The great, holy and awesome work of our teacher Rabbi Nachman of Breslov. Contains hundreds of "teachings" - holy discourses given by Rabbenu on Sabbaths, holidays and various occasions.
likutei-moharan.descriptionRussian: The great, holy and awesome work of our teacher Rabbi Nachman of Breslov. Contains hundreds of "teachings" - holy discourses given by Rabbenu on Sabbaths, holidays and various occasions.

kitzur-likutei-moharan.descriptionFrench: Shortened passages from the teachings of Rabbenu Rabbi Nachman, compiled under his direction by his student Rabbi Nathan.
kitzur-likutei-moharan.descriptionSpanish: Shortened passages from the teachings of Rabbenu Rabbi Nachman, compiled under his direction by his student Rabbi Nathan.
kitzur-likutei-moharan.descriptionRussian: Shortened passages from the teachings of Rabbenu Rabbi Nachman, compiled under his direction by his student Rabbi Nathan.

likutei-tefilot.descriptionFrench: The wonderful prayers of Rabbi Nathan, composed based on Rabbi Nachman's teachings from Likutei Moharan. About them Rabbenu said: "Prayers made from the teachings - cause delights above that never existed before!"
likutei-tefilot.descriptionSpanish: The wonderful prayers of Rabbi Nathan, composed based on Rabbi Nachman's teachings from Likutei Moharan. About them Rabbenu said: "Prayers made from the teachings - cause delights above that never existed before!"
likutei-tefilot.descriptionRussian: The wonderful prayers of Rabbi Nathan, composed based on Rabbi Nachman's teachings from Likutei Moharan. About them Rabbenu said: "Prayers made from the teachings - cause delights above that never existed before!"

alim-letrufah.descriptionFrench: Hundreds of letters from Rabbi Nathan, sent to his sons and students until close to his passing. These letters are a treasury of fear of Heaven, strengthening, holy conversations, and life-illuminating advice.
alim-letrufah.descriptionSpanish: Hundreds of letters from Rabbi Nathan, sent to his sons and students until close to his passing. These letters are a treasury of fear of Heaven, strengthening, holy conversations, and life-illuminating advice.
alim-letrufah.descriptionRussian: Hundreds of letters from Rabbi Nathan, sent to his sons and students until close to his passing. These letters are a treasury of fear of Heaven, strengthening, holy conversations, and life-illuminating advice.

siporei-masiyot.descriptionFrench: Thirteen tales, plus short stories, told by Rabbi Nachman in the last four years of his life. Recorded by his student Rabbi Nathan in Yiddish as told by Rabbenu and translated by him into Hebrew.
siporei-masiyot.descriptionSpanish: Thirteen tales, plus short stories, told by Rabbi Nachman in the last four years of his life. Recorded by his student Rabbi Nathan in Yiddish as told by Rabbenu and translated by him into Hebrew.
siporei-masiyot.descriptionRussian: Thirteen tales, plus short stories, told by Rabbi Nachman in the last four years of his life. Recorded by his student Rabbi Nathan in Yiddish as told by Rabbenu and translated by him into Hebrew.

sefer-hamidot.descriptionFrench: Contains short and concise passages about the excellence of good character traits and the obligation to distance oneself from bad ones. Written by Rabbenu in his youth, mostly collected from the sayings of our Sages.
sefer-hamidot.descriptionSpanish: Contains short and concise passages about the excellence of good character traits and the obligation to distance oneself from bad ones. Written by Rabbenu in his youth, mostly collected from the sayings of our Sages.
sefer-hamidot.descriptionRussian: Contains short and concise passages about the excellence of good character traits and the obligation to distance oneself from bad ones. Written by Rabbenu in his youth, mostly collected from the sayings of our Sages.

hishtapchut-hanefesh.descriptionFrench: A collection of wonderful conversations and speeches about the excellence of seclusion and the conversation of the Jew between him and his Creator - the main and central advice of our holy Rebbe Nachman.
hishtapchut-hanefesh.descriptionSpanish: A collection of wonderful conversations and speeches about the excellence of seclusion and the conversation of the Jew between him and his Creator - the main and central advice of our holy Rebbe Nachman.
hishtapchut-hanefesh.descriptionRussian: A collection of wonderful conversations and speeches about the excellence of seclusion and the conversation of the Jew between him and his Creator - the main and central advice of our holy Rebbe Nachman.

likutei-halakhot.descriptionFrench: The great and wonderful work of Rabbi Nathan, the outstanding student of our teacher Rabbi Nachman of Breslov, containing wonderful discourses on divine service, arranged according to the four sections of the Shulchan Aruch.
likutei-halakhot.descriptionSpanish: The great and wonderful work of Rabbi Nathan, the outstanding student of our teacher Rabbi Nachman of Breslov, containing wonderful discourses on divine service, arranged according to the four sections of the Shulchan Aruch.
likutei-halakhot.descriptionRussian: The great and wonderful work of Rabbi Nathan, the outstanding student of our teacher Rabbi Nachman of Breslov, containing wonderful discourses on divine service, arranged according to the four sections of the Shulchan Aruch.

likutei-etzot.descriptionFrench: The book of Rabbi Nathan of Breslov, containing practical advice for daily life brought from Rabbenu's books. The book is organized by topics and serves as a practical guide for divine service.
likutei-etzot.descriptionSpanish: The book of Rabbi Nathan of Breslov, containing practical advice for daily life brought from Rabbenu's books. The book is organized by topics and serves as a practical guide for divine service.
likutei-etzot.descriptionRussian: The book of Rabbi Nathan of Breslov, containing practical advice for daily life brought from Rabbenu's books. The book is organized by topics and serves as a practical guide for divine service.

etzot-hamevuarot.descriptionFrench: Compiled by Rabbi Shimshon Barsky, grandson of Rabbenu, originally in Yiddish. The book is an explanation of Rabbi Nathan's 'Likutei Etzot', written in a simple and flowing style suitable for all segments of the public.
etzot-hamevuarot.descriptionSpanish: Compiled by Rabbi Shimshon Barsky, grandson of Rabbenu, originally in Yiddish. The book is an explanation of Rabbi Nathan's 'Likutei Etzot', written in a simple and flowing style suitable for all segments of the public.
etzot-hamevuarot.descriptionRussian: Compiled by Rabbi Shimshon Barsky, grandson of Rabbenu, originally in Yiddish. The book is an explanation of Rabbi Nathan's 'Likutei Etzot', written in a simple and flowing style suitable for all segments of the public.

sichos-haran.descriptionFrench: "At first I thought only Rabbenu's teachings needed to be written," Rabbi Nathan said, "but later I understood that every conversation of his needs to be put in writing." Sichos Haran contains conversations said by Rabbenu during travels and journeys.
sichos-haran.descriptionSpanish: "At first I thought only Rabbenu's teachings needed to be written," Rabbi Nathan said, "but later I understood that every conversation of his needs to be put in writing." Sichos Haran contains conversations said by Rabbenu during travels and journeys.
sichos-haran.descriptionRussian: "At first I thought only Rabbenu's teachings needed to be written," Rabbi Nathan said, "but later I understood that every conversation of his needs to be put in writing." Sichos Haran contains conversations said by Rabbenu during travels and journeys.

chayei-moharan.descriptionFrench: In this work, Rabbi Nathan put to writing statements and speeches he heard from Rabbenu, revealing a glimpse of Rabbenu's enormous greatness. Divided by topics: conversations related to teachings, articles on divine service, on Rabbenu's greatness.
chayei-moharan.descriptionSpanish: In this work, Rabbi Nathan put to writing statements and speeches he heard from Rabbenu, revealing a glimpse of Rabbenu's enormous greatness. Divided by topics: conversations related to teachings, articles on divine service, on Rabbenu's greatness.
chayei-moharan.descriptionRussian: In this work, Rabbi Nathan put to writing statements and speeches he heard from Rabbenu, revealing a glimpse of Rabbenu's enormous greatness. Divided by topics: conversations related to teachings, articles on divine service, on Rabbenu's greatness.

yimei-maharanat.descriptionFrench: The wonderful diary of the outstanding and faithful student Rabbi Nathan. In it he unfolds the events of his life from his approach to Rabbenu until after his journey to the Land of Israel.
yimei-maharanat.descriptionSpanish: The wonderful diary of the outstanding and faithful student Rabbi Nathan. In it he unfolds the events of his life from his approach to Rabbenu until after his journey to the Land of Israel.
yimei-maharanat.descriptionRussian: The wonderful diary of the outstanding and faithful student Rabbi Nathan. In it he unfolds the events of his life from his approach to Rabbenu until after his journey to the Land of Israel.

kochvei-ohr.descriptionFrench: The book of Rabbi Avraham Chazan, son of Rabbi Nachman of Tulchyn, student of Rabbi Nathan. Contains four parts: 'People of Moharan' - stories about Rabbenu and his students, 'Truth and Faith' - conversations about the excellence of faith.
kochvei-ohr.descriptionSpanish: The book of Rabbi Avraham Chazan, son of Rabbi Nachman of Tulchyn, student of Rabbi Nathan. Contains four parts: 'People of Moharan' - stories about Rabbenu and his students, 'Truth and Faith' - conversations about the excellence of faith.
kochvei-ohr.descriptionRussian: The book of Rabbi Avraham Chazan, son of Rabbi Nachman of Tulchyn, student of Rabbi Nathan. Contains four parts: 'People of Moharan' - stories about Rabbenu and his students, 'Truth and Faith' - conversations about the excellence of faith.

tehilim.descriptionFrench: "Whoever wants to merit repentance - should be regular in saying Tehilim, for saying Tehilim is conducive to repentance" reveals our holy Rebbe Nachman. Special edition with large, clear letters, with Likutei Halakhot from Rabbi Nathan on the page.
tehilim.descriptionSpanish: "Whoever wants to merit repentance - should be regular in saying Tehilim, for saying Tehilim is conducive to repentance" reveals our holy Rebbe Nachman. Special edition with large, clear letters, with Likutei Halakhot from Rabbi Nathan on the page.
tehilim.descriptionRussian: "Whoever wants to merit repentance - should be regular in saying Tehilim, for saying Tehilim is conducive to repentance" reveals our holy Rebbe Nachman. Special edition with large, clear letters, with Likutei Halakhot from Rabbi Nathan on the page.

rosh-hashana-sheli.descriptionFrench: Contains a collection from Rabbenu's books about the excellence and holiness of Rosh Hashanah, and traveling to the true Tzaddik for Rosh Hashanah.
rosh-hashana-sheli.descriptionSpanish: Contains a collection from Rabbenu's books about the excellence and holiness of Rosh Hashanah, and traveling to the true Tzaddik for Rosh Hashanah.
rosh-hashana-sheli.descriptionRussian: Contains a collection from Rabbenu's books about the excellence and holiness of Rosh Hashanah, and traveling to the true Tzaddik for Rosh Hashanah.

itzumo-shel-yom.descriptionFrench: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Yom Kippur, as the Talmud says "the essence of the day atones".
itzumo-shel-yom.descriptionSpanish: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Yom Kippur, as the Talmud says "the essence of the day atones".
itzumo-shel-yom.descriptionRussian: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Yom Kippur, as the Talmud says "the essence of the day atones".

ki-naar-yisrael.descriptionFrench: A collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about educating children, including prayers for meriting God-fearing sons and daughters.
ki-naar-yisrael.descriptionSpanish: A collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about educating children, including prayers for meriting God-fearing sons and daughters.
ki-naar-yisrael.descriptionRussian: A collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about educating children, including prayers for meriting God-fearing sons and daughters.

toda-vehodaa.descriptionFrench: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence of thanks and gratitude to God, which have the power to bring a person from distress to relief.
toda-vehodaa.descriptionSpanish: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence of thanks and gratitude to God, which have the power to bring a person from distress to relief.
toda-vehodaa.descriptionRussian: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence of thanks and gratitude to God, which have the power to bring a person from distress to relief.

hatchalat-hathchlatot.descriptionFrench: "And now - all beginnings are from Purim" revealed our holy Rebbe Nachman. The book contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Purim day.
hatchalat-hathchlatot.descriptionSpanish: "And now - all beginnings are from Purim" revealed our holy Rebbe Nachman. The book contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Purim day.
hatchalat-hathchlatot.descriptionRussian: "And now - all beginnings are from Purim" revealed our holy Rebbe Nachman. The book contains a collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Purim day.

hitgalut-hadaat.descriptionFrench: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu Nachman and his student Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Passover, when the light of the faithful shepherd, Moses our teacher, is revealed anew in every generation.
hitgalut-hadaat.descriptionSpanish: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu Nachman and his student Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Passover, when the light of the faithful shepherd, Moses our teacher, is revealed anew in every generation.
hitgalut-hadaat.descriptionRussian: Contains a collection from all of Rabbenu Nachman and his student Rabbi Nathan's books about the excellence and holiness of Passover, when the light of the faithful shepherd, Moses our teacher, is revealed anew in every generation.

otzer-hayirah.descriptionFrench: Originally called: New Likutei Etzot. A collection and summary from Rabbi Nathan's "Likutei Halakhot" books, extracting all the practical advice from his lengthy discourses.
otzer-hayirah.descriptionSpanish: Originally called: New Likutei Etzot. A collection and summary from Rabbi Nathan's "Likutei Halakhot" books, extracting all the practical advice from his lengthy discourses.
otzer-hayirah.descriptionRussian: Originally called: New Likutei Etzot. A collection and summary from Rabbi Nathan's "Likutei Halakhot" books, extracting all the practical advice from his lengthy discourses.

chumash-likutei-halakhot.descriptionFrench: Set of five Torah volumes with illuminating letters, including Onkelos translation and Rashi commentary, plus a wonderful collection from Rabbi Nachman's teachings on the weekly portion, from Likutei Halakhot by Rabbi Nathan.
chumash-likutei-halakhot.descriptionSpanish: Set of five Torah volumes with illuminating letters, including Onkelos translation and Rashi commentary, plus a wonderful collection from Rabbi Nachman's teachings on the weekly portion, from Likutei Halakhot by Rabbi Nathan.
chumash-likutei-halakhot.descriptionRussian: Set of five Torah volumes with illuminating letters, including Onkelos translation and Rashi commentary, plus a wonderful collection from Rabbi Nachman's teachings on the weekly portion, from Likutei Halakhot by Rabbi Nathan.

kol-bo-leyeshuot.descriptionFrench: As its name suggests, it contains everything for salvation: Tikkun HaKlali, Tikkun Chatzot, afternoon and evening prayers, Song of Songs, recitations for salvation, segulot, prayers for graves of tzaddikim, and more.
kol-bo-leyeshuot.descriptionSpanish: As its name suggests, it contains everything for salvation: Tikkun HaKlali, Tikkun Chatzot, afternoon and evening prayers, Song of Songs, recitations for salvation, segulot, prayers for graves of tzaddikim, and more.

tikkun-haklali.descriptionFrench: The ten psalms that our holy Rebbe Nachman revealed for rectifying the covenant. In the Keren edition, each verse appears separately in illuminating size, according to the instruction and wish of Rabbi Israel Dov Odesser.
tikkun-haklali.descriptionSpanish: The ten psalms that our holy Rebbe Nachman revealed for rectifying the covenant. In the Keren edition, each verse appears separately in illuminating size, according to the instruction and wish of Rabbi Israel Dov Odesser.

yekara-deshabbata.descriptionFrench: Composed by Rabbi Nachman of Tchehrin, student of Rabbi Nathan. The book reveals the connection between Rabbenu's teachings in Likutei Moharan, Tales, and Sichos HaRan to the holiness of Shabbat.
yekara-deshabbata.descriptionSpanish: Composed by Rabbi Nachman of Tchehrin, student of Rabbi Nathan. The book reveals the connection between Rabbenu's teachings in Likutei Moharan, Tales, and Sichos HaRan to the holiness of Shabbat.
yekara-deshabbata.descriptionRussian: Composed by Rabbi Nachman of Tchehrin, student of Rabbi Nathan. The book reveals the connection between Rabbenu's teachings in Likutei Moharan, Tales, and Sichos HaRan to the holiness of Shabbat.

yareach-haeitanim.descriptionFrench: Composed by Rabbi Nachman of Tchehrin. Shows how all of Rabbenu's teachings contain the concepts of Rosh Hashana, Yom Kippur, Sukkot and Shemini Atzeret. "Yareach HaEitanim" refers to the month of Tishrei.
yareach-haeitanim.descriptionSpanish: Composed by Rabbi Nachman of Tchehrin. Shows how all of Rabbenu's teachings contain the concepts of Rosh Hashana, Yom Kippur, Sukkot and Shemini Atzeret. "Yareach HaEitanim" refers to the month of Tishrei.

maafer-lefaar.descriptionFrench: Collection from Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the Three Weeks period, expressing our longing for redemption and rebuilding the Temple, based on the verse "to give them beauty for ashes" (Isaiah).
maafer-lefaar.descriptionSpanish: Collection from Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the Three Weeks period, expressing our longing for redemption and rebuilding the Temple, based on the verse "to give them beauty for ashes" (Isaiah).
maafer-lefaar.descriptionRussian: Collection from Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the Three Weeks period, expressing our longing for redemption and rebuilding the Temple, based on the verse "to give them beauty for ashes" (Isaiah).

mem-tet-shaarim.descriptionFrench: Collection from Rabbenu's books about the holiness of the Counting of the Omer period between Passover and Shavuot, and matters related to these days. Shows the spiritual depth of counting as preparation for receiving the Torah.
mem-tet-shaarim.descriptionSpanish: Collection from Rabbenu's books about the holiness of the Counting of the Omer period between Passover and Shavuot, and matters related to these days. Shows the spiritual depth of counting as preparation for receiving the Torah.
mem-tet-shaarim.descriptionRussian: Collection from Rabbenu's books about the holiness of the Counting of the Omer period between Passover and Shavuot, and matters related to these days. Shows the spiritual depth of counting as preparation for receiving the Torah.

sod-harashbi.descriptionFrench: Collection from Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the greatness of the divine Tanna Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai and the merit of his hillula on Lag Ba'Omer. Reveals the deep connection between Rabbenu's teachings and Rashbi's holiness.
sod-harashbi.descriptionSpanish: Collection from Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the greatness of the divine Tanna Rabbi Shimon bar Yochai and the merit of his hillula on Lag Ba'Omer. Reveals the deep connection between Rabbenu's teachings and Rashbi's holiness.

shaar-hachamishim.descriptionFrench: Collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the holiness of Shavuot, known as the "Fiftieth Gate" of holiness, including "Tikkun Leil Shavuot" from the Ari and Shelah. Reveals the depth of the Torah-giving holiday.
shaar-hachamishim.descriptionSpanish: Collection from all of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books about the holiness of Shavuot, known as the "Fiftieth Gate" of holiness, including "Tikkun Leil Shavuot" from the Ari and Shelah. Reveals the depth of the Torah-giving holiday.

nachal-novea.descriptionFrench: Chapters in the life story of Rabbenu, with conversations and stories told by Rabbenu and his students. Published in 1961 by Holocaust survivor R. Yitzchak Eizik Zilberman, student of R. Yisrael Dov Odesser. Contains rare material about Rabbenu's life.
nachal-novea.descriptionSpanish: Chapters in the life story of Rabbenu, with conversations and stories told by Rabbenu and his students. Published in 1961 by Holocaust survivor R. Yitzchak Eizik Zilberman, student of R. Yisrael Dov Odesser. Contains rare material about Rabbenu's life.

sichos-vehitorerut.descriptionFrench: Contains the conversations, stories and words of awakening related to each teaching in Likutei Moharan, taken from "Chayei Moharan," "Yemei Maharanat," and "Alim LeTerufah." Compiled by Rabbi Shmuel Horowitz. Fundamental for understanding the depth of the teachings.

mikhtavei-rabbi-natan-tiveria.descriptionFrench: Book containing nearly two hundred letters written by Rabbi Nathan bar Yehuda of Tiberias, one of Rabbi Nathan's distinguished students, to friends in Israel and abroad. Full of enthusiastic conversations about the greatness of Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan.
mikhtavei-rabbi-natan-tiveria.descriptionSpanish: Book containing nearly two hundred letters written by Rabbi Nathan bar Yehuda of Tiberias, one of Rabbi Nathan's distinguished students, to friends in Israel and abroad. parparaot-al-hashas.descriptionFrench: Composed by Rabbi Nachman of Tchehrin, student of Rabbi Nathan. Contains deep and wondrous insights connecting the words of the Talmud to the foundations in Rabbenu's teachings in Likutei Moharan. Includes "Tovot Zichronot" with stories about Rabbi Nathan.
parparaot-al-hashas.descriptionSpanish: Composed by Rabbi Nachman of Tchehrin, student of Rabbi Nathan. Contains deep and wondrous insights connecting the words of the Talmud to the foundations in Rabbenu's teachings in Likutei Moharan. Includes "Tovot Zichronot" with stories about Rabbi Nathan.

likutei-even.descriptionFrench: Four books in one volume: Likutei Even by Rabbi Ephraim ben Rabbi Naftali based on Rabbenu's teachings and Orach Chaim; Morning Prayers; Emunat Itecha about utilizing time for divine service; and Etzot Yesharot - additions to Likutei Etzot.

avi-hanachal.descriptionFrench: The wonderful letters of Rabbi Yisrael Dov Odesser, especially those sent to Zalman Shazar. The letters contain holy words, strengthening and encouraging, from Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books, to strengthen weak knees and fortify drooping hands.
avi-hanachal.descriptionSpanish: The wonderful letters of Rabbi Yisrael Dov Odesser, especially those sent to Zalman Shazar. The letters contain holy words, strengthening and encouraging, from Rabbenu and Rabbi Nathan's books, to strengthen weak knees and fortify drooping hands.

yisrael-saba.descriptionFrench: The fiery and enthusiastic conversations of Rabbi Yisrael Dov Odesser from his later years. Compiled from recordings made by his close associates. Full of strengthening, fear of Heaven, love of God, love of the tzaddik and love of Israel.
yisrael-saba.descriptionSpanish: The fiery and enthusiastic conversations of Rabbi Yisrael Dov Odesser from his later years. Compiled from recordings made by his close associates. Full of strengthening, fear of Heaven, love of God, love of the tzaddik and love of Israel.

maayen-hamitgaber.descriptionFrench: Deep and wondrous insights on the holy book "Likutei Moharan," written by Rabbi Amram Yosef Horowitz, grandson of Rabbi Yisrael Dov Odesser. The book reveals additional layers in Rabbenu's teachings and deepens understanding of spiritual matters.

shemot-hatzadikim.descriptionFrench: Compiled by Rabbi Nathan, whose recitation is capable of changing nature and drawing miracles, according to our holy Rabbenu. Contains a list of names of tzaddikim and holy ones whose recitation with devotion can bring salvation and healing.

shema-yisrael.descriptionFrench: Small but important book containing the Shema prayer and its blessings, with intentions and explanations from Rabbenu's teachings. Designed for carrying in pocket and recitation at any time and place, especially in times of trouble or before sleep.
shema-yisrael.descriptionSpanish: Small but important book containing the Shema prayer and its blessings, with intentions and explanations from Rabbenu's teachings. Designed for carrying in pocket and recitation at any time and place, especially in times of trouble or before sleep.

emunat-itecha.descriptionFrench: Book by Rabbi Alter of Teplik about the virtue of utilizing time for divine service. Teaches how to dedicate every moment to serving the Creator and transform daily life into continuous spiritual work. Based on Rabbenu's teachings about time and remembering the Creator.
emunat-itecha.descriptionSpanish: Book by Rabbi Alter of Teplik about the virtue of utilizing time for divine service. Teaches how to dedicate every moment to serving the Creator and transform daily life into continuous spiritual work. Based on Rabbenu's teachings about time and remembering the Creator.

rabbenu-hakadosh.descriptionFrench: The complete life story of our holy Rabbenu Rabbi Nachman of Breslov, spanning nearly forty years of life, arranged in four elaborate volumes - a series collected from Rabbenu and his students' books plus oral traditions passed down through generations of elderly Chassidim.
